trans-unit.source: Specifies the versions of SOAP and WS-Addressing associated with a message and its exchange.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageVersion> contains the versioning information both about the SOAP envelope and the addressing protocol that is used by a message.

An instance of <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message> is bound upon creation to a specific <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageVersion> by passing the version as a parameter into one of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message.CreateMessage%2A> overloads.

All the static "get" properties in this class, such as <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageVersion.Soap11WSAddressing10%2A> and <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageVersion.Soap12%2A> have enumeration-like semantics.
They provide an enumeration of the possible message versions supported by the [!INCLUDE[indigo1](~/includes/indigo1-md.md)] runtime.
A message has an envelope structure and an addressing structure.
<xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageVersion> is just a shortcut for supplying {<xref:System.ServiceModel.EnvelopeVersion>, <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.AddressingVersion>} together.
There are currently two SOAP envelope versions available: SOAP 1.1 and SOAP 1.2.

These versions of SOAP are represented by <xref:System.ServiceModel.EnvelopeVersion> and are returned by the <xref:System.ServiceModel.EnvelopeVersion.Soap11%2A> and <xref:System.ServiceModel.EnvelopeVersion.Soap12%2A> properties.
The version of SOAP associated with the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageVersion> can be recovered by using the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageVersion.Envelope%2A> property.
[!INCLUDE[crdefault](~/includes/crdefault-md.md)] the schema for [SOAP 1.1](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=96641) and [SOAP 1.2](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=96642).
There are currently two versions of WS-Addressing available.
The one submitted on 10 August 2004 and the one specified in the WS-Addressing 1.0 protocol.
The address version used by the current message version can be recovered using the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageVersion.Addressing%2A> property.

These versions of WS-Addressing are represented by <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.AddressingVersion> and are returned by the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.AddressingVersion.WSAddressingAugust2004%2A> and <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.AddressingVersion.WSAddressing10%2A> properties.
The WS-Addressing August 2004 is retained as a legacy value.
The 10 August 2004 W3C Member Submission for WS-Addressing is available at [Web Services Addressing (WS-Addressing)](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=96643).
The 17 August 2005 W3C Candidate Recommendation for WS-Addressing 1.0 - Core is available at [Web Services Addressing 1.0 - Core](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=96644).
<xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.AddressingVersion.None%2A> provides support for using "plain old XML" (POX)-style messaging.
Enabling basic POX messaging is now a matter of setting up an HTTP binding on your service with a text encoder that uses <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.AddressingVersion.None%2A>.
Message version objects can be created using specified versions of WS-Addressing and SOAP using one of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageVersion.CreateVersion%2A> overloads.
Gets or sets the version of WS-Addressing that is associated with the current message version.

These versions of WS-Addressing are represented by <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.AddressingVersion> and are returned by the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.AddressingVersion.WSAddressingAugust2004%2A> and <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.AddressingVersion.WSAddressing10%2A> properties.
The WS-Addressing August 2004 is retained as a legacy value.
The 10 August 2004 W3C Member Submission for WS-Addressing is available at [Web Services Addressing (WS-Addressing)](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=96643).
The 17 August 2005 W3C Candidate Recommendation for WS-Addressing 1.0 - Core is available at [Web Services Addressing 1.0 - Core](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=96644).
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.AddressingVersion"></xref> that is associated with the current message version.
Creates a message version object by using WS-Addressing 1.0 and with a specified SOAP version.
The SOAP versions currently available are SOAP 1.1 and SOAP 1.2.
There is an <xref:System.ServiceModel.EnvelopeVersion> for each version of SOAP that contains the data relevant to its use.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.EnvelopeVersion"></xref> that indicates the SOAP version to be used.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageVersion"></xref> using the specified version of SOAP and WS-Addressing 1.0.
The envelopeVersion is `null`.
Creates a message version object with specified SOAP and WS-Addressing versions.
The SOAP versions currently available are SOAP 1.1 and SOAP 1.2.
There is an <xref:System.ServiceModel.EnvelopeVersion> for each version of SOAP that contains the data relevant to its use.
There are currently two versions of WS-Addressing available.
One submitted 10 August 2004 and the other submitted August 2005 and referred to as the WS-Addressing 1.0 protocol.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.EnvelopeVersion"></xref> that indicates the SOAP version.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.AddressingVersion"></xref> that indicates the WS-Addressing version.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageVersion"></xref> using the specified versions of WS-Addressing and SOAP.
envelopeVersion or addressingVersion is `null`.
Gets the default message version used by [!INCLUDE[indigo1](~/includes/indigo1-md.md)].
This returns the same object as <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageVersion.Soap12WSAddressing10%2A>.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageVersion"></xref> that uses WS-Addressing 1.0 and SOAP1.2.
Gets the SOAP version associated with the current message version.
There are currently two SOAP envelope versions available: SOAP 1.1 and SOAP 1.2.

These versions of SOAP are represented by <xref:System.ServiceModel.EnvelopeVersion> and are returned by the <xref:System.ServiceModel.EnvelopeVersion.Soap11%2A> and <xref:System.ServiceModel.EnvelopeVersion.Soap12%2A> properties.
The version of SOAP associated with the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageVersion> can be recovered by using the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageVersion.Envelope%2A> property.
[!INCLUDE[crdefault](~/includes/crdefault-md.md)] the schema for [SOAP 1.1](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=96641) and [SOAP 1.2](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=96642).
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.EnvelopeVersion"></xref> associated with the current message version.
Returns a value that indicates whether the current message version is equal to a specified object.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to compare with the current message version.
`true` if the specified object is equal to the current <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageVersion"></xref> object; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a hash code for the current message version.
A unique hash code for the current <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageVersion"></xref>.
Gets the message version that does not use SOAP or WS-Addressing.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageVersion.None%2A> consists of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.EnvelopeVersion.None%2A> and <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.AddressingVersion.None%2A>.
This provides support for using "plain old XML" (POX)-style messaging.
Enabling basic POX messaging is now a matter of setting up an HTTP binding on your service with a text encoder that uses <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.AddressingVersion.None%2A>.

Note that when a service is configured with the <xref:System.ServiceModel.BasicHttpBinding> and the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageVersion> is set to <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageVersion.None%2A>, the action header in a request message is removed from the response message.
This is consistent with the way ASMX services work.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageVersion"></xref> that does not use SOAP or WS-Addressing.
Gets the message version using SOAP 1.1.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageVersion"></xref> using SOAP 1.1 but no version of WS-Addressing.
Gets the message version using WS-Addressing 1.0 and SOAP 1.1.
For more information and the schemas for WS-Addressing 1.0 and SOAP 1.1, see the following:
[Web Services Addressing 1.0 - Core](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=96644)
[WS-Addressing 1.0 schema](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=96647)
[SOAP 1.1 schema](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=96641)
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageVersion"></xref> using the version of WS-Addressing 1.0 and SOAP 1.1.
Gets the message version by using WS-Addressing submitted 10 August 2004 and SOAP 1.1.
For more information and the schemas for the 10 August 2004 W3C Member Submission for WS-Addressing and SOAP 1.1, see the following:
[10 August 2004 W3C Member Submission for WS-Addressing](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=96643)
[WS-Addressing submitted 10 August 2004 schema](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=96648)
[SOAP 1.1](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=96641)
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageVersion"></xref> using the version of WS-Addressing submitted 10 August 2004 and SOAP 1.1.
Gets the message version using SOAP 1.2.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageVersion"></xref> using SOAP 1.2 but no version of WS-Addressing.
Gets the message version using WS-Addressing 1.0 and SOAP 1.2.
For more information and the schemas of the 17 August 2005 W3C Candidate Recommendation for WS-Addressing and SOAP 1.2, see the following:
[17 August 2005 W3C Candidate Recommendation for WS-Addressing 1.0 - Core](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=96644)
[WS-Addressing 1.0 schema](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=96647)
[SOAP 1.2 schema](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=96642)
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageVersion"></xref> using the version of WS-Addressing 1.0 and SOAP 1.2.
Gets the message version using WS-Addressing submitted August 2004 and SOAP 1.2.
For more information and the schemas for 10 August W3C Member Submission for WS-Addressing and SOAP 1.2, see the following:
[10 August 2004 W3C Member Submission for WS-Addressing](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=96643)
[WS-Addressing submitted 10 August 2004 schema](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=96648)
[SOAP 1.2 schema](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=96642)
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageVersion"></xref> using the version of WS-Addressing submitted 10 August 2004 and SOAP 1.2.
Returns the string representation of the current message version.
The string representation of the current message version.
